event.title: Cycles
event.name: CPU Cycles
event.description: The counter increments on every cycle

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Increment PMSWINC Register
event.description: The counter increments on writes to the PMSWINC register

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: Counts any instruction fetch which misses in the cache. This does not count; cache maintenance instructions and non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: This event counts any refill of the L1 instruction TLB from the MMU Translation Cache (MMUTC). This includes refills that result in a translation fault. TLB maintenance instructions are not counted. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: This event counts any load or store operation or translation table walk access which causes data to be read from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1. The following instructions are not counted; Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches, Stores of an entire cache line, even if they make a coherency request outside the L1, Partial cache line writes which do not allocate into the L1 cache and Non-cacheable accesses. This event counts the sum of 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (due to read)' and 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (due to write)'.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: This event counts any load or store operation or translation table walk access which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the 'L1 Data Cache: Refill' event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted; Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches and Non-cacheable accesses. This event counts the sum of 'L1 Data Cache: Access (due to read)' and 'L1 Data Cache: Access (due to write)'.

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: This event counts any refill of the data L1 TLB from the MMUTC. This includes refills that result in a translation fault. TLB maintenance instructions are not counted. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter increments for every architecturally executed instruction

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Taken
event.description: The counter increments for each exception taken

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Exception Returns
event.description: The counter increments for each executed exception return instruction

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to CONTEXTIDR
event.description: The counter increments for every write to the CONTEXTIDR

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to PC
event.description: The counter increments for every software change of the PC. This includes all: Branch instructions, memory reading instructions that explicitly write to the PC, Data processing instructions that explicitly write to the PC, and Exception return instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Immediate)
event.description: The counter counts all immediate branch instructions that are architecturally executed

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Return)
event.description: The counter counts all procedure return instructions that are architecturally executed

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Mispredictions
event.description: The counter counts each correction to the predicted program flow that occurs because of a misprediction from, or no prediction from, a change in control flow that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Possible Predictions
event.description: The counter counts every branch or other change in the program flow that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access
event.description: This event counts memory accesses due to load or store instructions. The following instructions are not counted; Instruction fetches, Cache maintenance instructions, Translation table walks or prefetches. This event counts the sum of 'Memory: Access (due to read)' and 'Memory: Access (due to write)'.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: This event counts any instruction fetch which accesses the L1 instruction cache or MOP cache. The following instructions are not counted; cache maintenance instructions, non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back
event.description: The counter counts every write-back of data from the Level 1 data or unified cache. The counter counts each write-back that causes data to be written from the Level 1 cache to outside of the Level 1 cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: This event counts any transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache, and any writeback from the L1 to the L2. Snoops from outside the core and cache maintenance operations are not counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: This event counts any cacheable transaction from L1 which causes data to be read from outside the core. L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 are not counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back
event.description: This event counts any write-back of data from the L2 cache to outside the core. This includes snoops to the L2 which return data, regardless of whether they cause an invalidation. Invalidations from the L2 which do not write data outside of the core and snoops which return data from the L1 are not counted.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access
event.description: This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the data channels between the core and the Snoop Control Unit (SCU). If both read and write data beats are transferred on a given cycle, this event is counted twice on that cycle. This event counts the sum of 'Bus: Access (due to read)', 'Bus: Access (due to write)', and any snoop data responses.

event.title: Errors
event.name: Memory
event.description: Local memory error This event counts any correctable or uncorrectable memory error (ECC or parity) in the protected core RAMs

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: All
event.description: Operation speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to TTBR
event.description: The counter counts writes to the translation table base registers, TTBR0 and TTBR1

event.title: Cycles
event.name: Bus Cycles
event.description: Bus cycles This event duplicates 'Cycles: CPU Cycles'

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Allocation
event.description: L2 data cache allocation without refill. This event counts any full cache line write into the L2 cache which does not cause a linefill, including write-backs from L1 to L2 and full-line writes which do not allocate into L1.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Any)
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed, branch This event counts all branches, taken or not. This excludes exception entries, debug entries and CCFAIL branches.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Mispredicted)
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed, mispredicted branch This event counts any branch counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Any)' which is not correctly predicted and causes a pipeline flush

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend
event.description: No operation issued because of the frontend. The counter counts on any cycle when there are no fetched instructions available to dispatch.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend
event.description: No operation issued because of the backend The counter counts on any cycle fetched instructions are not dispatched due to resource constraints

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: Level 1 data TLB access This event counts any load or store operation which accesses the data L1 TLB. If both a load and a store are executed on a cycle, this event counts twice. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: Level 1 instruction TLB access This event counts any instruction fetch which accesses the instruction L1 TLB. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled.

event.title: L2 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts attributable instruction memory accesses that access at least the Level 2 instruction or unified cache. Each attributable access to other Level 2 instruction memory structures, such as refill buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L2 Instruction Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L2 Instruction Cache: Access' that causes a demand refill of any of the Level 1 or 2 caches outside the Level 1 or 2 caches of this PE. A refill includes any access that causes data to be fetched from outside the cache, even if the data is ultimately not allocated into the cache. For example, data might be fetched into a buffer but then discarded, rather than being allocated into a cache. These buffers are treated as part of the cache.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Allocation
event.description: Attributable L3 cache allocation without refill This event counts any full cache line write into the L3 cache which does not cause a linefill, including write-backs from L2 to L3 and full-line writes which do not allocate into L2

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: Attributable L3 cache refill This event counts for any cacheable read transaction returning data from the SCU for which the data source was outside the cluster. Transactions such as ReadUnique are counted as read transactions, even though they can be generated by store instructions.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: Attributable L3 cache access This event counts for any cacheable read transaction returning data from the SCU, or for any cacheable write to the SCU

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: Attributable L2 TLB refill This event counts on any refill of the MMUTC, caused by either an instruction or data access. This event does not count if the MMU is disabled.

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: Attributable L2 TLB access This event counts on any access to the MMUTC (caused by a refill of any of the L1 TLBs). This event does not count if the MMU is disabled.

event.title: Multi-socket Remote Access
event.name: Access
event.description: Access to another socket in a multi-socket system

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each memory read operation or memory write operation that causes a cache access to at least the Last Level data or unified cache. If the cache is shared, only events attributable to this PE are counted. If the cache is not shared, all events are counted.

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Translation table walk
event.description: Access to data TLB that caused a page table walk This event counts on any data access which causes 'L2 Data TLB: Refill' to count

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Translation table walk
event.description: Access to instruction TLB that caused a translation table walk. This event counts on any instruction access which causes 'L2 Data TLB: Refill' to count.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: Last level cache access, read If CPUECTLR. EXTLLC is set, then this event counts any cacheable read transaction which returns a data source of interconnect cache. If CPUECTLR. EXTLLC is not set, then this event is a duplicate of the L*D_CACHE_RD event corresponding to the last level of cache implemented 'L2 Data Cache: Access (due to read)' if only one is implemented, or 'L1 Data Cache: Access (due to read)' if neither is implemented.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Miss (due to read)
event.description: Last level cache miss, read If CPUECTLR. EXTLLC is set, then this event counts any cacheable read transaction which returns a data source of DRAM, remote, or inter-cluster peer. If CPUECTLR. EXTLLC is not set, then this event is a duplicate of the L*D_CACHE_REFILL_RD event corresponding to the last level of cache implemented 'L2 Data Cache: Refill (due to read)' if only one is implemented, or 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (due to read)' if neither is implemented.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (due to long-latency read)
event.description: Level 1 data cache long-latency miss

event.title: Operations
event.name: Executed
event.description: Micro-operation architecturally executed

event.title: Operations
event.name: Speculated
event.description: Micro-operation speculatively executed

event.title: Stalls
event.name: All
event.description: No operation sent for execution

event.title: Stalls (Slots)
event.name: Backend
event.description: No operation sent for execution on a slot due to the backend

event.title: Stalls (Slots)
event.name: Frontend
event.description: No operation sent for execution on a slot due to the frontend

event.title: Stalls (Slots)
event.name: All
event.description: No operation sent for execution on a slot

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: This event counts any load operation or page table walk access which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (due to read)' event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted; cache maintenance instructions and prefetches, non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: This event counts any store operation which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (due to write)' event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted; cache maintenance instructions and prefetches, non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: This event counts any load operation or page table walk access which causes data to be read from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1. The following instructions are not counted; xache maintenance instructions and prefetches, non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to write)
event.description: This event counts any store operation which causes data to be read from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1. The following instructions are not counted; cache maintenance instructions and prefetches, stores of an entire cache line, even if they make a coherency request outside the L1, partial cache line writes which do not allocate into the L1 cache, non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (from inside cluster)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory operations that generate refills satisfied by transfer from another cache inside of the immediate cluster

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (from outside cluster)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory operations that generate refills satisfied by transfer from another cache outside of the immediate cluster

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back (due to reuse)
event.description: L1 data cache write-back, victim

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back (due to clean)
event.description: L1 data cache write-back cleaning and coherency

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Invalidation
event.description: The counter counts each invalidation of a cache line in the Level 1 data or unified cache

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: L1 data TLB refill, read

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Refill (due to write)
event.description: L1 data TLB refill, write

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: L1 data TLB access, read

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: L1 data TLB access, write

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: L2 cache access, read. This event counts any read transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache. Snoops from outside the core are not counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: L2 cache access, write. This event counts any write transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache or any write-back from L1 which allocates into the L2 cache. Snoops from outside the core are not counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: This event counts any cacheable read transaction from L1 which causes data to be read from outside the core. L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 should not be counted. Transactions such as ReadUnique are counted as read transactions, even though they can be generated by store instructions.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to write)
event.description: This event counts any write transaction from L1 which causes data to be read from outside the core. L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 should not be counted. Transactions such as ReadUnique are not counted as write transactions.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back (due to reuse)
event.description: L2 cache write-back, victim

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back (due to clean)
event.description: L2 cache write-back, cleaning and coherency

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Invalidation
event.description: The counter counts each invalidation of a cache line in the Level 2 data or unified cache

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: L2 TLB refill, read

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Refill (due to write)
event.description: L2 TLB refill, write

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: L2 TLB access, read

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: L2 TLB access, write

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the read data channel between the core and the SCU

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: Bus access write This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the write data channel between the core and the SCU

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: This event counts memory accesses due to load instructions. The following instructions are not counted; instruction fetches, cache maintenance instructions, translation table walks, prefetches.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: This event counts memory accesses due to store instructions. The following instructions are not counted; instruction fetches, cache maintenance instructions, translation table walks, prefetches.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to unaligned read)
event.description: Unaligned access, read

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to unaligned write)
event.description: Unaligned access, write

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to unaligned read or write)
event.description: Unaligned access

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load-Exclusive
event.description: The counter counts Load-Exclusive instructions speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store-Exclusive (Successes)
event.description: The counter counts Store-Exclusive instructions speculatively executed that completed a write

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store-Exclusive (Failures)
event.description: The counter counts Store-Exclusive instructions speculatively executed that fail to complete a write. It is within the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED definition of speculatively executed whether this includes conditional instructions that fail the condition code check.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store-Exclusive
event.description: The counter counts Store-Exclusive instructions speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-reading instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Load' event

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-writing instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Store' event

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load/Store
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-reading and memory-writing instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Load' and 'Instructions (Executed): Store' events

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Integer)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only integer data-processing instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Advanced SIMD)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only Advanced SIMD data-processing instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Floating-point)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only floating-point data-processing instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (software PC writes)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only software changes of the PC

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Crypto
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only Cryptographic instructions, except PMULL and VMULL

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (immediate)
event.description: The counter counts immediate branch instructions speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (return)
event.description: The counter counts procedure return instructions speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (indirect)
event.description: The counter counts indirect branch instructions speculatively executed. This includes software change of the PC other than exception-generating instructions and immediate branch instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Barrier (ISB)
event.description: The counter counts Instruction Synchronization Barrier instructions speculatively executed, including CP15ISB

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Barrier (DSB)
event.description: The counter counts data synchronization barrier instructions speculatively executed, including CP15DSB

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Barrier (DMB)
event.description: The counter counts data memory barrier instructions speculatively executed, including CP15DSB. It does not include the implied barrier operations of load/store operations with release consistency semantics.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Barrier (CSDB)
event.description: The counter counts control speculation barrier instructions speculatively executed

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Undefined
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are not counted by 'Exceptions: SVC', 'Exceptions: SMC', 'Exceptions: HVC', 'Exceptions: Instruction Abort', 'Exceptions: Data Abort', 'Exceptions: IRQ', and 'Exceptions: FIQ'

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: SVC
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are Supervisor Call exceptions

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Instruction Abort
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are Instruction Abort exceptions

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Data Abort
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are Data Abort or SError interrupt exceptions

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: IRQ
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are IRQ or Virtual IRQ exceptions

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: FIQ
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are FIQ or Virtual FIQ exceptions

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: SMC
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions that are Secure Monitor Call exceptions excluding those that are trapped as Hyp Trap exceptions

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: HVC
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions that are Hypervisor Call exceptions including both those taken locally and from non-secure EL1/PL1

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Trap (Instruction Abort)
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions not taken locally that are Instruction Abort exceptions

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Trap (Data Abort)
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions not taken locally that are Data Abort or SError interrupt exceptions

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Trap (Other)
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are not counted by 'Exceptions: SMC', 'Exceptions: HVC', 'Exceptions: Trap (Instruction Abort)', 'Exceptions: Trap (Data Abort)', 'Exceptions: Trap (IRQ)', and 'Exceptions: Trap (FIQ)'

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Trap (IRQ)
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions not taken locally that are IRQ exceptions

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Trap (FIQ)
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions not taken locally that are FIQ exceptions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load (Acquire)
event.description: The counter counts memory-read operations with acquire or acquirepc semantics that are speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store (Release)
event.description: The counter counts memory-write operations with release semantics that are speculatively executed

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'L3 Data Cache: Access', but counts only attributable memory-read operations that cause a cache access to at least the Level 3 data or unified cache

event.title: L2 Unified Cache
event.name: Late prefetch
event.description: L2 prefetch requests, late

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Refill (by SW preload)
event.description: Counts L2 DTLB refills that occur as a result of a software prefetch

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Flag renames full)
event.description: Counts cycles when backend is stalled even when operations are available from the frontend but at least one is not ready to be sent to the backend because no flag rename register is available

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (General renames full)
event.description: Counts cycles when backend is stalled even when operations are available from the frontend but at least one is not ready to be sent to the backend because no general purpose rename register is available

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Vector renames full)
event.description: Counts cycles when backend is stalled even when operations are available from the frontend but at least one is not ready to be sent to the backend because no vector rename register is available

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Full issue queue (SX))
event.description: Counts cycles counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Backend busy)' when the backend could not accept any micro-operations because the simple integer issue queues are full to take any operations for execution

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Full issue queue (MX))
event.description: Counts cycles counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Backend busy)' when the backend could not accept any micro-operations because the complex integer issue queues are full and can not take any operations for execution

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Full issue queue (LS))
event.description: Counts cycles when the backend could not accept any micro-operations because the load/store issue queues are full and can not take any operations for execution

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Full issue queue (VX))
event.description: Counts cycles counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Backend busy)' when the backend could not accept any micro-operations because the vector issue queues are full and can not take any operations for execution

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (MCQ full)
event.description: Counts cycles counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Backend busy)' when the backend could not accept any micro-operations because the commit queue is full and can not take any operations for execution

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Hit (Line, prefetched)
event.description: L1D demand including L1 HWPRF hit on prefetched L2 line

event.title: L2 CHI
event.name: RXDAT/RXRSP with CBusy of 0
event.description: Count of RXDAT or RXRSP responses received with indication completer fullness indicator set to 0

event.title: L2 CHI
event.name: RXDAT/RXRSP with CBusy of 1
event.description: Count of RXDAT or RXRSP responses received with indication completer fullness indicator set to 1

event.title: L2 CHI
event.name: RXDAT/RXRSP with CBusy of 2
event.description: Count of RXDAT or RXRSP responses received with indication completer fullness indicator set to 2

event.title: L2 CHI
event.name: RXDAT/RXRSP with CBusy of 3
event.description: Count of RXDAT or RXRSP responses received with indication completer fullness indicator set to 3

event.title: L2 CHI
event.name: RXDAT/RXRSP with CBusy Multi-threaded set
event.description: Count of RXDAT or RXRSP responses received with indication completer indicating multiple cores actively making requests

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (by L1 HW prefetcher)
event.description: Counts level 2 cache accesses due to level 1 data cache hardware prefetcher

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (by L1 HW prefetcher)
event.description: Counts level 2 cache refills where the cache line is requested by a level 1 data cache hardware prefetcher

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Predicate renames full)
event.description: Counts cycles when backend is stalled even when operations are available from the frontend but at least one is not ready to be sent to the backend because no predicate rename register is available

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Other CPUBOUND)
event.description: Counts cycles when backend is stalled even when operations are available from the frontend but at least one is not ready to be sent to the backend because a cpu resource other than renames or issue queues

event.title: Operations issued
event.name: Branch
event.description: This event counts each resolution from the branch execution pipelines

event.title: Operations issued
event.name: Integer
event.description: This event counts each resolution from the integer execution pipelines

event.title: Operations issued
event.name: Vector/Float
event.description: This event counts each resolution from the vector execution pipelines

event.title: Operations issued
event.name: Load/Store
event.description: This event counts each resolution from the load store execution pipelines

event.title: Operations issued
event.name: Store data
event.description: This event counts each resolution for store data operations

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Power throttling linked to low confidence branches)
event.description: Counts cycles when the frontend did not send any micro-operations to the rename stage as the frontend is actively throttle throughput based on speculation around low confidence branches

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Architectural or microarchitectural flushes)
event.description: Counts cycles when the frontend could not send any micro-operations to the rename stage as the frontend is recovering from a machine flush due to taken exceptions or other micro-architectural flushes not related to branch mispredictions

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Flush for branch mispredictions)
event.description: Counts cycles when the frontend could not send any micro-operations to the rename stage as the frontend is recovering from a resteer due to branch mispredictions

event.title: Memory
event.name: Completed in DRAM
event.description: Counts access where the data was sourced from the DRAM

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Power throttling linked to low confidence branches)
event.description: Counts cycles when the backend did not accept any micro-operations as the backend is actively throttle throughput based on speculation around low confidence branches

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (SME busy)
event.description: The counter counts each PE cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Processor Bound)' when the PEs backend was stalled due SME instructions not able to progress, typically: - When waiting for SME arbitration - Because of SME backpressure - Because instructions cannot be sent to SME due to dependencies, commit, etc

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (SME backpressure)
event.description: The counter counts each CPU cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (SME busy)' when the SME causes backpressure and does not accept instructions. Notes: - This event counts independently of oldest instruction being ready to be sent to the SME unit - This event does not count when the CPU is waiting for arbitration, and 'Stalls: Backend (SME arbitration)' is counting.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (SME arbitration)
event.description: The counter counts each CPU cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (SME busy)' when oldest SME instruction cannot be sent because it is waiting for arbitration

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (SME stalled by CPU)
event.description: The counter counts each PE cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (SME busy)' when not counted by 'Stalls: Backend (SME backpressure)' or 'Stalls: Backend (SME arbitration)'. This can typically be due to: - Instruction waiting for commit point being reached - A register dependency prevents the SSVE oldest instruction to be sent - A control packet needs to be sent.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (SME stalled on LSRT full)
event.description: The counter counts each CPU cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Memory bound)' when at least one Streaming SVE instruction is waiting for an entry being freed to be allocated into the LSRT

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Barrier stalled by SME)
event.description: The counter counts each CPU cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Memory bound)' when a barrier instruction is executed and waits for completions from SME load/store transactions. This includes effect due to store-release or load-acquire semantic.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (SME stalled by CPU memory hazard)
event.description: The counter counts each CPU cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Memory bound)' when at least one Streaming SVE load/store instruction is waiting for resolution from an address hazard. This could be used to detect cases for which the CPU and SME are making overlapping accesses, that is, both are accessing the same location, and the SME cannot accept the operation to preserve the ordering of memory effects for the location required by the architecture.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (CPU stalled by SME memory hazard)
event.description: The counter counts each CPU cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Memory bound)' when at least one CPU load/store instruction is waiting for resolution from an address hazard. This could be used to detect cases for which the CPU and SME are making overlapping accesses, that is, both are accessing the same location, and the CPU cannot execute the operation to preserve the ordering of memory effects for the location required by the architecture.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (SME stalled on memory hazard or LSRT full)
event.description: The counter counts each CPU cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Memory bound)' when at least one Streaming SVE instruction is waiting for an entry being freed to be allocated into the LSRT or an address hazard to be resolved

event.title: SME
event.name: Allocated
event.description: The counter counts each PE cycle counted by 'Cycles: CPU Cycles' where the CPU had an SME granted arbitration to it, such that the SME and Streaming SVE state of the CPU is held in that SME. It does not count cycles during which a CPU has requested arbitration and is waiting for acknowledgement.

event.title: SME
event.name: Arbitration pending
event.description: The counter counts each PE cycle counted by 'Cycles: CPU Cycles' where the CPU is in waiting for arbitration while attempting to access a SME. If can be due an initial arbitration request or contention.

event.title: SME
event.name: Reconnect pending
event.description: The counter counts each PE cycle counted by 'SME: Arbitration pending' where the CPU is in waiting for arbitration due to contention, when it was previously arbitrated to a SME but arbitration was granted to another CPU

event.title: SME
event.name: Arbitration Requests
event.description: The counter counts the number of times an arbitration to SME is requested, either an initial request, or a reconnect request due to contention

event.title: SME
event.name: Reconnect Requests
event.description: The counter counts the number of times the CPU needs to request arbitration following a disconnect due to contention

event.title: SME Operations Issued
event.name: All
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by OP_ISSUE that was issued to a streaming mode compute unit. The definition of which operations are issued to an SME is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED. The maximum value by which the counter could increment by in a single cycle is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SVE' when the CPU executes in Streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SVE' specifically in Streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Load/Store)
event.description: The counter counts each Load or Store instruction counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): SVE (Load/Store)'` when CPU executes in Streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Load)
event.description: The counter counts each Load instruction counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): SVE (Load)'` when CPU executes in Streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Store)
event.description: The counter counts each Store instruction counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): SVE (Store)'` when CPU executes in Streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Prefetch)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed prefetch operation due to any of the following A64 instructions: - SVE: PRFB, PRFD, PRFH, or PRFW. - SME: RPRFM This counts in Streaming mode only.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Integer)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed integer arithmetic operation due to an SVE data-processing instruction listed in SVE integer instructions. This counter only counts operations executed in Streaming mode.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed floating-point operation due to an SVE instruction, specifically in streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Integer, 8-bit)
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Integer)' where the largest type is 8-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Integer, 16-bit)
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Integer)' where the largest type is 16-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Integer, 32-bit)
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Integer)' where the largest type is 32-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Integer, 64-bit)
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Integer)' where the largest type is 64-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Half precision)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed half-precision floating-point operation due to an SVE instruction, specifically in streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, BFloat16)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed BFloat16 floating-point operation due to an SVE instruction, specifically in streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Single precision)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed single-precision floating-point operation due to an SVE instruction, specifically in streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Double precision)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed double-precision floating-point operation due to an SVE instruction, specifically in streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Integer, Multiply)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed integer multiply or multiply-accumulate operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Integer)', specifically in Streaming mode, due to any of the following instructions: - SVE: MAD, MLA, MLS, MSB, MUL, SMULH, or UMULH. - SVE2: CMLA, MLA, MLS, MUL, PMUL, SMLALB, SMLALT, SMLSLB, SMLSLT, SMULH, SMULLB, SMULLT, SQDMLALB, SQDMLALBT, SQDMLALT, SQDMLSLB, SQDMLSLBT, SQDMLSLT, SQDMULH, SQDMULLB, SQDMULLT, SQRDCMLAH, SQRDMLAH, SQRDMLSH, SQRDMULH, UMLALB, UMLALT, UMLSLB, UMLSLT, UMULH, UMULLB, or UMULLT.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Integer, Dot Product)
event.description: The counter counts each integer dot product operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Integer, Dot-Product (Advanced SIMD and SVE)' due to any of the following instructions: - SVE: SDOT, SUDOT, UDOT, or USDOT. - SVE2: CDOT, SUDOT, or USDOT.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Add/Subtract)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed floating-point add or subtract operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)' due to any of the following instructions: - SVE: FABD, FADD, FSUB, or FSUBR

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Multiply)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed floating-point multiply operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)' due to any of the following instructions: - SVE: FMUL, FMULX, or FTSMUL

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, FMA)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed floating-point fused multiply-add or multiply-subtract operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Floating Point, FMA (all)', specifically in Streaming mode, due to any of the following instructions: - SVE: BFMLALB (vectors), BFMLALT (vectors), FCMLA (vectors), FMAD, FMLA (vectors), FMLS (vectors), FMSB, FNMAD, FNMLA, FNMLS, FNMSB, or FTMAD. - SVE2: BFMLALB (vectors), BFMLALT (vectors), FMLALB (vectors), FMLALT (vectors), FMLSLB (vectors), or FMLSLT (vectors).

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Dot Product)
event.description: The counter counts each dot-product operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)' due to any of the following instructions: - SVE: BFDOT. - SVE2: BFDOT.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Square Root)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed floating-point square-root operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)', specifically in Streaming mode, due to any of the following instructions: - SVE: FSQRT

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Divide)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed floating-point divide operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Floating Point, Divide (all)', specifically in Streaming mode, due to any of the following instructions: - SVE: FDIV or FDIVR

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Reciprocal Estimate)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed floating-point reciprocal estimate operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)', specifically in Streaming mode, due to any of the following instructions: - SVE: FRECPE or FRSQRTE

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Convert)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed floating-point convert operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)', specifically in Streaming mode, due to an SVE instruction

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Floating Point, Vector Reduction)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed floating-point treewise reduction operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)', specifically in Streaming mode, due to any of the following A64 instructions: - SVE: FADDV, FMAXNMV, FMAXV, FMINNMV, or FMINV

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Predicated)
event.description: Counts operations counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SVE (Predicated)', but in Streaming mode only. Note: this counts SME operations requiring PSTATE. ZA to be set, including 2D operations.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (No Active Predicates)
event.description: Counts operations counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SVE (No Active Predicates)', but in Streaming mode only

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (All Active Predicates)
event.description: Counts speculatively executed predicated SVE operations with all predicate elements active, specifically in Streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (No / Partially Active Predicates)
event.description: Counts speculatively executed predicated SVE operations with at least one non active predicate elements, specifically in Streaming mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Partially Active Predicates)
event.description: Counts speculatively executed predicated SVE operations with at least one but not all active predicate elements, specifically in streaming mode

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (Streaming SVE,SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each Streaming SVE floating-point ALU operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)' that was speculatively executed. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (Streaming SVE,Half precision, SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each Streaming SVE floating-point half-precision ALU operation counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)'` that was speculatively executed. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (Streaming SVE,BFloat16, SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each Streaming SVE floating-point BFloat16 ALU operation counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)'` that was speculatively executed. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (Streaming SVE,Single precision, SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each Streaming SVE floating-point single-precision ALU operation counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)'` that was speculatively executed. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (Streaming SVE,Double precision, SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each Streaming SVE floating-point double-precision ALU operation counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Floating Point)'` that was speculatively executed. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Integer (Streaming SVE,SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each Streaming SVE integer ALU operation counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): Streaming SVE (Integer)'` that was speculatively executed. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Load/Store (Streaming SVE,SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed memory read operation or memory write operation due to either: - An SVE predicated vector load or store instruction other than a replicating LD1R or LD1RQ instruction. - An SME vector load or store instruction The counter increments by the number of elements accessed by the instruction per `128/element_size` vector of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Load (Streaming SVE,SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed memory read operation due to either: - An SVE predicated vector load instruction other than a replicating LD1R or LD1RQ instruction. - An SME vector load instruction The counter increments by the number of elements accessed by the instruction per 128/element_size vector of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Store (Streaming SVE,SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed Memory-store operation due to either: - An SVE predicated vector store instruction. - An SME vector store instruction The counter increments by the number of elements accessed by the instruction per 128/element_size vector of the result.

event.title: ALU Bytes Transfered
event.name: Load/Store (Streaming SVE, SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed memory read operation or memory write operation due to either: - An SVE predicated vector load or store instruction other than a replicating LD1R or LD1RQ instruction. - An SME vector load or store instruction For each instruction, the counter is incremented by `(16 / (CSIZE / MSIZE))`, multiplied by the number of transferred vector registers.

event.title: ALU Bytes Transfered
event.name: Load (Streaming SVE, SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed memory read operation due to either: - An SVE predicated vector load instruction other than a replicating LD1R or LD1RQ instruction. - An SME vector load instruction For each instruction, the counter is incremented by `(16 / (CSIZE / MSIZE))`, multiplied by the number of transferred vector registers.

event.title: ALU Bytes Transfered
event.name: Store (Streaming SVE, SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed memory write operation due to either: - An SVE predicated vector store instruction. - An SME vector store instruction For each instruction, the counter is incremented by `(16 / (CSIZE / MSIZE))`, multiplied by the number of transferred vector registers.

event.title: ALU Bytes Transfered
event.name: Load/Store (Streaming SVE, FP / ASIMD / Non-vector)
event.description: The counter counts each byte speculatively read or written in SVE streaming due to any of: - Any Advanced SIMD or SVE non-vector load or store operation. - An SVE replicating LD1R or LD1RQ instruction. For each instruction, the counter is incremented by the number of bytes transferred per register multiplied by the number of registers transferred multiplied by the number of transfers made per register. For example, the counter counts bytes as follows: - SVE and Advanced SIMDLD1Rinstructions increment the counter by `(MSIZE / 8)`. - SVELD1RQ instructions increment the counter by 16.

event.title: Cycles
event.name: SME Cycles
event.description: Counts SME clock cycles (not timer cycles). The clock measured by this event is defined as the physical clock driving the SME logic.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: SME
event.description: Counts instructions that have been architecturally executed inside the SME

event.title: Ops (Executed)
event.name: SME
event.description: Counts micro-operations that are architecturally executed. This is a count of number of micro-operations retired from the commit queue in a single cycle.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME (All)
event.description: Counts cycles when no operations are sent to the SME rename unit from the SME frontend or from the SME rename unit to the SME backend for any reason (either frontend or backend stall)

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Frontend
event.description: No operation has been issued, because of the frontend. The counter counts on any cycle when no operations are issued while instruction queues are not full.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Frontend (Waiting on CPU)
event.description: The counter counts cycles when 'Stalls: SME Frontend' increments, due to not enough instructions being sent by the CPU

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Frontend (Other CPU)
event.description: The counter counts cycles when 'Stalls: SME Frontend' increments, due to instructions received by another CPU in the system

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Backend
event.description: Counts cycles whenever the SME rename unit is unable to send any micro-operations to the SME backend of the pipeline because of backend resource constraints. Backend resource constraints can include issue stage fullness, execution stage fullness, or other internal pipeline resource fullness.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Backend (Data Processing)
event.description: Counts cycles when 'Stalls: SME Backend' is set, due to DP issue queues not accepting instructions

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Backend (Memory)
event.description: Counts cycles when 'Stalls: SME Backend' is set, due to Load-Store issue queues not accepting instructions

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Backend (Prefetcher)
event.description: Counts cycles when 'Stalls: SME Backend' is set, due to prefetcher issue queues not accepting instructions

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Backend (Memory, waiting on cache)
event.description: Counts cycles when 'Stalls: SME Backend (Memory)' is set, with the oldest instruction in at least one of the load issue queues waiting for cache arbitration

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Backend (Memory, waiting on store)
event.description: Counts cycles when 'Stalls: SME Backend (Memory)' is set, with the oldest instruction in at least one of the store issue queues waiting for the merge buffer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load / Store (SME)
event.description: Counts load and store operations that have been speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load (SME)
event.description: Counts speculatively executed SME load operations including Single Instruction Multiple Data (SIMD) load operations executed in streaming SVE mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load / Store (SME, Unaligned)
event.description: Counts unaligned memory operations issued by the CPU. This event counts unaligned accesses (as defined by the actual instruction), even if they are subsequently issued as multiple aligned accesses.

event.title: Latency
event.name: Access with additional latency from alignment (SME)
event.description: Counts the number of memory read and write accesses in a cycle that incurred additional latency, due to the alignment of the address and the size of data being accessed, which results in store crossing a single cache line

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load (SME, Unaligned)
event.description: Counts unaligned memory read operations issued by the CPU. This event counts unaligned accesses (as defined by the actual instruction), even if they are subsequently issued as multiple aligned accesses. The event does not count preload operations (PLD, PLI).

event.title: Latency
event.name: Load with additional latency from alignment (SME)
event.description: Counts the number of memory read accesses in a cycle that incurred additional latency, due to the alignment of the address and size of data being accessed, which results in load crossing a single cache line

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store (SME)
event.description: Counts speculatively executed SME store operations including Single Instruction Multiple Data (SIMD) load operations executed in streaming SVE mode

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store (SME, Unaligned)
event.description: Counts unaligned memory write operations issued by the CPU. This event counts unaligned accesses (as defined by the actual instruction), even if they are subsequently issued as multiple aligned accesses.

event.title: Latency
event.name: Store with additional latency from alignment (SME)
event.description: Counts the number of memory write accesses in a cycle that incurred additional latency, due to the alignment of the address and the size of data being accessed, which results in store crossing a single cache line

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Prefetch (SME)
event.description: Counts speculatively executed operations in Streaming SVE mode that prefetch memory, executed by SME. Only the SME RPRFM instructions are counted by this event.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Dispatch (IQ full, DP0)
event.description: Count cycles counted by 'Stalls: SME Backend' when at least one instruction should be sent to Issue Queue DP0, and this issue queue is full

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Dispatch (IQ full, DP1)
event.description: Count cycles counted by 'Stalls: SME Backend' when at least one instruction should be sent to Issue Queue DP1, and this issue queue is full

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Dispatch (IQ full, Load)
event.description: Count cycles counted by 'Stalls: SME Backend' when at least one instruction should be sent to Issue Queue LD, and this issue queue is full

event.title: SME Operations Issued
event.name: ALU
event.description: Count number of operations issued to an ALU execution unit at each cycle

event.title: SME Operations Issued
event.name: Multiply-Accumulate
event.description: Count number of operations issued to a MAC execution unit at each cycle

event.title: SME Operations Issued
event.name: Permute
event.description: Count number of operations issued to a Permute execution unit at each cycle

event.title: SME Operations Issued
event.name: Store
event.description: Count number of operations issued to a Store execution unit at each cycle

event.title: SME Operations Issued
event.name: Matrix Multiply (Data)
event.description: Count number of operations issued to a Matmul Datapath execution unit at each cycle

event.title: SME Operations Issued
event.name: Matrix Multiply (Move)
event.description: Count number of operations issued to a Matmul Move execution unit at each cycle

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: Bus (SME, Read)
event.description: Counts memory transaction requests issued by the CPU to the external bus, including snoop requests and snoop responses in progress on a processor cycle

event.title: Bus
event.name: Bus request (SME)
event.description: Counts memory transaction requests issued by the CPU to the external bus, including snoop requests and snoop responses

event.title: Bus
event.name: Bus request (SME, due to read)
event.description: Counts memory read transaction requests issued by the CPU to the external bus, including snoop requests and snoop responses

event.title: Bus
event.name: Bus request (SME, due to write)
event.description: Counts memory write transaction requests issued by the CPU to the external bus, including snoop requests and snoop responses

event.title: Cycles
event.name: SME Bus Cycles
event.description: Counts bus cycles in the SME. Bus cycles represent a clock cycle in which a transaction could be sent or received on the interface from the SME to the external bus.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (SME)
event.description: Counts memory transactions issued by the SME to the external bus, including snoop requests and snoop responses. Each beat of data is counted individually.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (SME, due to read)
event.description: Counts memory read transactions seen on the external bus. Each beat of data is counted individually.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (SME, due to write)
event.description: Counts memory write transactions seen on the external bus. Each beat of data is counted individually.

event.title: Snooping (Data)
event.name: Hit (SME)
event.description: This event counts each data snoop that hits in a cache outside of the SME cache

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME)
event.description: Counts each memory-read operation or memory-write operation that causes a level 1 data cache accesses. Each access to a cache line is counted including the multiple accesses caused by single instructions such as multiple-vector operations. Each access to other level 1 data or unified memory structures, for example refill buffers, write buffers, and write-back buffers, are also counted.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (SME)
event.description: Counts each access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that hits in the level 1 data cache

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (SME, due to read/write)
event.description: Counts cache line hits in the level 1 data cache due to Load or Store operations

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (SME, due to read)
event.description: Counts cache line hits in the level 1 data cache due to Load operations

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (SME, due to write)
event.description: Counts cache line hits in the level 1 data cache due to Store operations

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (SME, by HW prefetcher, due to read/write, first)
event.description: The counter counts each demand access first hit counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Hit (due to read/write)' where the cache line was fetched by a hardware prefetcher. That is, the 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (by HW prefetcher)' event was generated when the cache line was fetched into the cache. Only the first hit by a demand access is counted. After this event is generated for a cache line, the event is not generated again for the same cache line while it remains in the cache.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (SME)
event.description: Counts access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that miss in the level 1 data cache

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, due to read/write)
event.description: Counts level 1 data demand cache accesses from any load or store operation

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, due to read)
event.description: Counts level 1 data cache accesses from any load operation

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, due to write)
event.description: Counts level 1 data cache accesses generated by store operations

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, by HW prefetcher, or SW preload)
event.description: Counts level 1 data cache accesses from hardware prefetcher, software preload or prefetch instructions

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, by HW prefetcher)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a hardware prefetch. The hardware prefetch is generated by a hardware prefetcher at the Level 1 data or unified cache.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, by SW preload)
event.description: Counts level 1 data cache accesses from software preload or prefetch instructions

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (SME)
event.description: Counts each access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that causes a level 1 data cache refill due to a miss in the level 1 data cache. This event only counts one event per cache line.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (SME, from inside cluster)
event.description: Counts level 1 data cache refills where the cache line data came from caches inside the immediate cluster of the core

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (SME, from outside cluster)
event.description: Counts level 1 data cache refills for which the cache line data came from outside the immediate cluster of the core, like an SLC in the system interconnect or DRAM

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (SME, due to read)
event.description: Counts level 1 data cache refills caused by speculatively executed load instructions where the memory read operation misses in the level 1 data cache. This event only counts one event per cache line.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (SME, due to write)
event.description: Counts level 1 data cache refills caused by speculatively executed store instructions where the memory write operation misses in the level 1 data cache. This event only counts one event per cache line.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Invalidation (SME)
event.description: Counts each explicit invalidation of a cache line in the level 1 data cache caused by broadcast cache coherency operations from another CPU in the system. This event does not count for the following conditions: 1. A cache refill invalidates a cache line. 2. Invalidation during hardware power-off sequence.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (SME, due to long-latency read)
event.description: Counts cache line refills into the level 1 data cache from any memory read operations, that incurred additional latency

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back (SME)
event.description: Counts write-backs of dirty data from the L1 data cache to the next cache. This occurs when either a dirty cache line is evicted from L1 data cache and allocated in the next cache or dirty data is written to the next cache and possibly to the next level of cache. This event counts both victim cache line evictions and cache write-backs from snoops or cache maintenance operations. The following cache operations are not counted: 1. Invalidations which do not result in data being transferred out of the L1 (such as evictions of clean data), 2. Full line writes which write to next level of cache without writing L1, such as write streaming mode.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back (SME, due to clean)
event.description: Counts write-backs from the level 1 data cache that are a result of a coherency operation made by another CPU. Event count includes cache maintenance operations.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back (SME, due to reuse)
event.description: Counts dirty cache line evictions from the level 1 data cache caused by a new cache line allocation. This event does not count evictions caused by cache maintenance operations.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME)
event.description: Counts level 3 cache accesses. Level 3 cache is a unified cache for data and instruction accesses. Accesses are for misses in the lower level caches or translation resolutions due to accesses.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, due to read/write)
event.description: Counts level 3 cache accesses caused by any memory read or write operation. level 3 cache is a unified cache for data and instruction accesses. Accesses are for misses in the lower level caches or translation resolutions due to accesses.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, due to read)
event.description: Sum of L3 cache reads from all Pipelines

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, due to write)
event.description: L3 cache write

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Allocation (SME)
event.description: Counts level 3 cache line allocates that do not fetch data from outside the level 3 data or unified cache. For example, allocates due to streaming stores.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (SME, due to long-latency read)
event.description: Counts any cache line refill into the level 3 cache from memory read operations that incurred additional latency

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (SME)
event.description: Counts level 3 cache accesses that hit in the level 3 cache

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (SME)
event.description: Counts level 3 cache accesses that missed in the level 3 cache

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (SME)
event.description: Counts level 3 accesses that receive data from outside the L3 cache

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (SME, by SW preload)
event.description: Counts cacheable reads generated by hardware or software prefetches that receive data from outside the L3 cache

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (SME, due to read)
event.description: - This event duplicates 'L3 Data Cache: Refill'. - If either the core is configured without a per-core L2 or the cluster is configured without an L3 cache, this event is not implemented.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Access (SME)
event.description: Counts transactions that were returned from outside the core cluster. This event counts when the system register CMECFG. EXTLLC bit is set.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Access (SME, due to read)
event.description: Counts read transactions that were returned from outside the core cluster. This event counts when the system register CMECFG. EXTLLC bit is set. This event counts read transactions returned from outside the core if those transactions are either hit in the system level cache or missed in the SLC and are returned from any other external sources. This event is a superset of the 'Last Level Cache: Miss (SME, due to read)' event.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Miss (SME, due to read)
event.description: Counts read transactions that were returned from outside the core cluster but missed in the system level cache. This event counts when the system register CMECFG. EXTLLC bit is set. This event counts read transactions returned from outside the core if those transactions are missed in the System level Cache. The data source of the transaction is indicated by a field in the CHI transaction returning to the CPU. This event does not count reads caused by cache maintenance operations. This event is a subset of the 'Last Level Cache: Access (SME, due to read)' event.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Hit (SME)
event.description: Counts transactions that were returned from outside the core cluster, hitting in the last. level cache. This event counts when the system register CMECFG. EXTLLC bit is set.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (SME)
event.description: Counts memory accesses issued by the SME load store unit, where those accesses are issued due to load or store operations. This event counts memory accesses no matter whether the data is received from any level of cache hierarchy or external memory. If memory accesses are broken up into smaller transactions than what were specified in the load or store instructions, then the event counts those smaller memory transactions.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (SME, due to read)
event.description: Counts memory accesses issued by the CPU due to load operations. The event counts any memory load access, no matter whether the data is received from any level of cache hierarchy or external memory. The event also counts atomic load operations. If memory accesses are broken up by the load/store unit into smaller transactions that are issued by the bus interface, then the event counts those smaller transactions.

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: Memory (SME, Read)
event.description: Counts the number of outstanding loads or memory read accesses per cycle

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (SME, due to write)
event.description: Counts memory accesses issued by the SME due to store operations. The event counts any memory store access, no matter whether the data is located in any level of cache or external memory. If memory accesses are broken up by the load/store unit into smaller transactions that are issued by the bus interface, then the event counts those smaller transactions.

event.title: Multi-socket Remote Access
event.name: Access (SME)
event.description: Counts accesses to another chip, which is implemented as a different CMN mesh in the system. If the CHI bus response back to the core indicates that the data source is from another chip (mesh), then the counter is updated. If no data is returned, even if the system snoops another chip/mesh, then the counter is not updated.

event.title: Multi-socket Remote Access
event.name: Access (SME, due to read)
event.description: Counts read accesses to another chip, which is implemented as a different CMN mesh in the system. If the CHI bus response back to the core indicates that the data source is from another chip (mesh), then the counter is updated. If no data is returned, even if the system snoops another chip/mesh, then the counter is not updated.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME Max power throttle cycles
event.description: Count number of SME cycles during which Max Power mitigation mechanisms causes throttling of the unit, impacting performance

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME L3 TXDAT link-credit stall
event.description: Count number of SME cycles stalls due to missing L3 TXDAT link-credit

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME L3 TXRSP link-credit stall
event.description: Count number of SME cycles stalls due to missing L3 TXRSP link-credit

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SME L3 TXREQ link-credit stall
event.description: Count number of SME cycles stalls due to missing L3 TXREQ link-credit

event.title: SME
event.name: Dataless evicts
event.description: Count number of writeback evictions converted to dataless EVICT

event.title: Streaming SVE
event.name: Slow instructions
event.description: Number of instructions which are considered as slow instructions (communication to the CPU, serializing instruction)

event.title: Streaming SVE
event.name: Slow instructions producing a General purpose register
event.description: Number of instructions producing a GPR register (not XZR/WZR) from the SME unit to the CPU

event.title: Streaming SVE
event.name: Slow instructions producing a predicate register
event.description: Number of instructions producing a Predicate register from the SME unit to the CPU

event.title: Streaming SVE
event.name: Slow instructions producing condition flags
event.description: Number of instructions producing a Flag register (CPSR) from the SME unit to the CPU

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SSVE Context Switch
event.description: Cycles inside the SME unit lost for context switch (new instructions will be stalled in decode stage). Counted for a CPU by the time arbitration acknowledge is sent to the time first instruction can be executed.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: SSVE Context Switch (Fast)
event.description: Cycles inside the SME unit lost because a CPU loads/stores its context (without causing a real context switch)

event.title: SME Operations Issued
event.name: Divide / Square Root
event.description: Count number of operations issued to a DIV/SQRT execution unit at each cycle

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Streaming SVE (Unpredicated)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed data-processing, load, or store operation due to an Streaming SVE instruction without a Governing predicate operand. This counts the SME operations requiring PSTATE. ZA to be set. It does not count Advanced SIMD operations.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access to DRAM (SME)
event.description: Counts access where the data was sourced from the DRAM

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (SME, by HW prefetcher, due to read/write, first, line-fill buffer)
event.description: The counter counts each demand access first hit in outstanding where the cache line was fetched by a hardware prefetcher. Only the first hit by a demand access is counted. After this event is generated for a cache line, the event is not generated again for the same cache line while it remains in the cache.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Integer, Other)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed instruction counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Integer)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array, which is not counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Integer, Dot Product)', 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Integer, Matrix Outer Product Accumulate)' or 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Integer, Multiply)'

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Floating Point, Other)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively instruction counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array, which is not counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point, Add/Subtract)', 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point, Dot Product)', 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point, FMA)' or 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point, Matrix Outer Product Accumulate)'

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (SME, by SW preload)
event.description: Counts level 1 data cache refills where the cache line access was generated by software preload or prefetch instructions

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (SME, by HW prefetcher)
