event.description: Counts each hardware prefetch counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access (by HW prefetcher)' that causes a refill of the Level 1 data or unified cache from outside of the Level 1 data or unified cache

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, by SW preload)
event.description: Counts level 3 cache accesses generated by software prefetches

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (SME, by HW prefetcher)
event.description: Counts level 3 cache accesses generated by hardware prefetches

event.title: Statistical Profiling
event.name: Sample Population
event.description: The counter counts each operation that might be sampled, whether or not the operation was sampled. Operations that are executed at an Exception level or Security state in which the Statistical Profiling Extension is disabled are not counted.

event.title: Statistical Profiling
event.name: Sample Feed
event.description: The counter counts each time the sample interval counter reaches zero and is reloaded, and the sample does not collide with the previous sample. Samples that are removed by filtering, or discarded, and not written to the Profiling Buffer are counted.

event.title: Statistical Profiling
event.name: Sample Filtered
event.description: The counter counts each sample counted by 'Statistical Profiling: Sample Feed' that is not removed by filtering. Sample records that are not removed by filtering, but are discarded before being written to the Profiling Buffer because of a Profiling Buffer management event or because Discard mode is implemented and enabled, are counted.

event.title: Statistical Profiling
event.name: Sample Collision
event.description: The counter counts each time the sample interval counter reaches zero and is reloaded, and the sample collides with the previous sample because the previous sampled operation has not completed generating its sample record

event.title: Cycles
event.name: AMU Constant Cycles
event.description: Constant frequency cycles

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Memory Stall Cycles)
event.description: No operation sent due to the backend and memory stalls

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Miss (long-latency)
event.description: L1 instruction cache long latency miss

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (due to long-latency read)
event.description: L2 cache long latency miss

event.title: L2 Instruction Cache
event.name: Miss (long-latency)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L2 Instruction Cache: Access' that incurs additional latency because it returns instructions from outside the Level 2 instruction cache. The event indicates to software that the access missed in the Level 2 instruction cache and might have a significant performance impact due to the additional latency, compared to the latency of an access that hits in the Level 2 instruction cache.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (due to long-latency read)
event.description: L3 cache long latency miss

event.title: PMU
event.name: Overflows (EL1, EL0)
event.description: PMU overow, counters accessible to EL1 and EL0

event.title: PMU
event.name: Overflows (EL2)
event.description: PMU overow, counters reserved for use by EL2

event.title: Latency
event.name: Access with additional latency from alignment
event.description: Access with additional latency from alignment

event.title: Latency
event.name: Load with additional latency from alignment
event.description: Load with additional latency from alignment

event.title: Latency
event.name: Store with additional latency from alignment
event.description: Store with additional latency from alignment

event.title: MTE
event.name: Checked data memory access
event.description: Checked data memory access

event.title: MTE
event.name: Checked data memory access, read
event.description: Checked data memory access, read

event.title: MTE
event.name: Checked data memory access, write
event.description: Checked data memory access, write

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: SVE and Avanced SIMD (SIMD only)
event.description: The counter counts the following architecturally executed SIMD instructions. : SVE instructions, but not non-SIMD SVE instructions. Advanced SIMD instructions, but not Advanced SIMD scalar instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE and Advanced SIMD (SIMD only)
event.description: The counter counts each Speculatively executed operation due to either: An SVE instruction that is not a non-SIMD SVE instruction. An A64 Advanced SIMD instruction that is not an Advanced SIMD scalar instruction.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Advanced SIMD
event.description: Advanced SIMD operations speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE
event.description: SVE operations speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Floating Point (all)
event.description: The counter counts speculatively executed operations due to scalar, Advanced SIMD, and SVE floating-point instructions. These instructions are in the floating point instructions category and optionally the floating-point conversions instructions category and the floating-point or integer instructions category listed in the Arm Architecture Reference Manual Supplement, The Scalable Vector Extension (SVE), for Armv8-A.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Floating Point, Half-Precision (all)
event.description: Half-precision floating-point operation speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Floating Point, Single-Precision (all)
event.description: Single-precision floating-point operation speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Floating Point, Double-Precision (all)
event.description: Double-precision floating-point operation speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Integer (all)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed integer arithmetic operation due to an A64 scalar, Advanced SIMD, and SVE data-processing instruction listed in SVE integer instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Integer (Advanced SIMD and SVE)
event.description: The counter counts speculatively executed integer arithmetic operations due to Advanced SIMD and SVE data-processing instructions. These instructions are listed in the integer instructions category and optionally the floating-point conversions category and the floating-point or integer category in the Arm Architecture Reference Manual Supplement, The Scalable Vector Extension (SVE), for Armv8-A.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): All' that is a scalable vector data processing operation. It does not count: - SME operations counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME'. - Neon operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Data Processing (Advanced SIMD)' - Load/store operations.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE and Avanced SIMD (all)
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): All' that is an Advanced SIMD or scalable vector data processing operation. It does not count: - SME operations counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME'. - Load/store operations See 'Instructions (Speculated): Data Processing (Advanced SIMD)' and 'Instructions (Speculated): SVE' for these classifications.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (Predicated)
event.description: SVE predicated operations speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (No Active Predicates)
event.description: SVE predicated operations with no active predicates speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (All Active Predicates)
event.description: SVE predicated operations speculatively executed with all active predicates

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (Partially Active Predicates)
event.description: SVE predicated operations speculatively executed with partially active predicates

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (Unpredicated)
event.description: The counter counts speculatively executed SIMD data-processing and load/store operations due to SVE instructions without a Governing predicate

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (No / Partially Active Predicates)
event.description: SVE predicated operations speculatively executed with a Governing predicate in which at least one element is FALSE

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (Load/Store)
event.description: The counter counts speculatively executed operations that read from, write to, or prefetch memory due to SVE instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (Load)
event.description: The counter counts speculatively executed operations that read from memory due to SVE load instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (Store)
event.description: The counter counts speculatively executed operations that write to memory due to SVE store instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (Prefetch)
event.description: The counter counts speculatively executed operations that prefetch memory due to SVE prefetch instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Prefetch (all)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that prefetches memory due to any of the following A64 instructions: Scalar: PRFM. SVE: PRFB, PRFD, PRFH, or PRFW.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (Load, First-fault)
event.description: SVE First-fault load operations speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE (Load, First-fault, Write 0 to FFR)
event.description: SVE First-fault load operations speculatively executed which set FFR bit to 0

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (SVE)
event.description: Scalable floating-point element operations speculatively executed

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (FP / ASIMD / Non-vector)
event.description: Non-scalable floating-point element operations speculatively executed

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (SME)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed scalable floating-point matrix arithmetic operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Floating Point (all)'. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size by 128/element_size tile of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (Half precision, SME)
event.description: The counter counts each Streaming SVE half-precision floating-point matrix ALU operation counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)'` that was speculatively executed. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size by 128/element_size tile of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (BFloat16, SME)
event.description: The counter counts each Streaming SVE half-precision floating-point matrix ALU operation counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)'` that was speculatively executed. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size by 128/element_size tile of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (Single precision, SME)
event.description: The counter counts each Streaming SVE single-precision floating-point matrix ALU operation counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)'` that was speculatively executed. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size by 128/element_size tile of the result.

event.title: ALU Operations
event.name: Floating Point (Double precision, SME)
event.description: The counter counts each Streaming SVE double-precision floating-point matrix ALU operation counted by `'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)'` that was speculatively executed. The counter increments by the number of numerical operations carried out by the instruction per 128/element_size by 128/element_size tile of the result.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Integer, 8-bit (Advanced SIMD and SVE)
event.description: Operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Integer (Advanced SIMD and SVE)' where the largest type is 8-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Integer, 16-bit (Advanced SIMD and SVE)
event.description: Operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Integer (Advanced SIMD and SVE)' where the largest type is 16-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Integer, 32-bit (Advanced SIMD and SVE)
event.description: Operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Integer (Advanced SIMD and SVE)' where the largest type is 32-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Integer, 64-bit (Advanced SIMD and SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Integer (Advanced SIMD and SVE)' where the largest type is an 64-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (immediate branch taken)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Immediate)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Write to PC'. These are all direct branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is taken.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (indirect branch taken excluding returns)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (indirect branch)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Write to PC', that is not counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Return)'. These are all indirect branch instructions, excluding return instructions, on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is taken.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted immediate branch)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Immediate)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (predicted branch)'. These are all direct branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (mispredicted immediate branch)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Immediate)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Mispredicted)'. These are all direct branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is mispredicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted indirect branch)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (indirect branch)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (predicted branch)'. These are all indirect branch instructions, including return instructions, on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (mispredicted indirect branch)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (indirect branch)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Mispredicted)'. These are all indirect branch instructions, including return instructions, on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is mispredicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted procedure return)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (predicted indirect branch)' where if taken, the branch would be counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Return)'. These are all return instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (mispredicted procedure return)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (mispredicted indirect branch)' where if taken, the branch would also be counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Return)'. These are all return instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is mispredicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted indirect branch, excluding return)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (predicted indirect branch)' where if taken, the branch would not be counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Return)'. These are all indirect branch instructions, excluding return instructions, on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (mispredicted indirect branch, excluding return)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (mispredicted indirect branch)' where if taken, the branch would not be counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Return)'. These are all indirect branch instructions, excluding return instructions, on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is mispredicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted branch, taken)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (predicted branch)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Write to PC'. These are all branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted and taken.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (mispredicted branch, taken)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Mispredicted)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Write to PC'. These are all branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is mispredicted and taken.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted branch, not taken)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (predicted branch)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (branch not taken)'. These are all branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted and not taken.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (mispredicted branch, not taken)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Mispredicted)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (branch not taken)'. These are all branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is mispredicted and not taken.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted branch)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Any)' that is not counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Mispredicted)'. These are all branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (indirect branch)
event.description: The counter counts each Software change of the PC that is not counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Immediate)'. Software change of the PC has the same definition as for the 'Instructions (Executed): Write to PC' and 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (branch not taken)' events. Note: conditional branches are always counted, regardless of whether the branch is taken.

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: Instruction Fetch
event.description: Event in progress, 'Memory: Access (due to instruction fetch)'

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: Memory (Read)
event.description: Event in progress, 'Memory: Access (due to read)'

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to instruction fetch)
event.description: Instruction memory access

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: Bus (Read)
event.description: Bus read transactions in progress

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: DTLB Walk
event.description: Event in progress, 'Data TLB: Translation table walk'

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: ITLB Walk
event.description: Event in progress, 'Instruction TLB: Translation table walk'

event.title: Statistical Profiling
event.name: Sample Feed (branch)
event.description: Statistical Profiling sample taken, branch. The counter counts each sample counted by 'Statistical Profiling: Sample Feed' that are branch operations.

event.title: Statistical Profiling
event.name: Sample Feed (load)
event.description: Statistical Profiling sample taken, load. The counter counts each sample counted by 'Statistical Profiling: Sample Feed' that are load or load atomic operations.

event.title: Statistical Profiling
event.name: Sample Feed (store)
event.description: Statistical Profiling sample taken, store. The counter counts each sample counted by 'Statistical Profiling: Sample Feed' that are store or atomic operations, including load atomic operations.

event.title: Statistical Profiling
event.name: Sample Feed (matching operation type)
event.description: Statistical Profiling sample taken, matching operation type. The counter counts each sample counted by 'Statistical Profiling: Sample Feed' that meets the operation type filter constraints.

event.title: Statistical Profiling
event.name: Sample Feed (matching events)
event.description: Statistical Profiling sample taken, matching events. The counter counts each sample counted by 'Statistical Profiling: Sample Feed' that meets the Events packet filter constraints.

event.title: Statistical Profiling
event.name: Sample Feed (exceeding minimum latency)
event.description: Statistical Profiling sample taken, exceeding minimum latency. The counter counts each sample counted by 'Statistical Profiling: Sample Feed' that meets the operation latency filter constraints.

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Access (due to read/write)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data TLB: Access' that is due to a demand memory read operation or demand memory write operation

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction TLB: Access' that is due to a demand Instruction memory access

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Access (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data TLB: Access' that is due to a preload or prefetch instruction

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Access (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction TLB: Access' that is due to a preload or prefetch instruction

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Hardware update of translation table
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data TLB: Access' that causes a hardware update of a translation table entry

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Hardware update of translation table
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction TLB: Access' that causes a hardware update of a translation table entry

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Translation table walk, step
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk access made by a refill of the data or unified TLB

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Translation table walk, step
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk access made by a refill of the instruction TLB

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Large page translation table walk
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk counted by 'Data TLB: Translation table walk' where the result of the walk yields a large page size

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Large page translation table walk
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk counted by 'Instruction TLB: Translation table walk' where the result of the walk yields a large page size

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Small page translation table walk
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk counted by 'Data TLB: Translation table walk' where the result of the walk yields a small page size

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Small page translation table walk
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk counted by 'Instruction TLB: Translation table walk' where the result of the walk yields a small page size

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Demand access, at least one table walk
event.description: Data TLB demand access with at least one translation table walk. The counter counts each demand access counted by 'L1 Data TLB: Access (due to read/write)' that causes a refill or update of a data or unified TLB involving at least one translation table walk access.

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Demand access (with a translation table walk)
event.description: The counter counts each demand access counted by 'L1 Instruction TLB: Access (due to read)' that causes a refill or update of an instruction TLB involving at least one translation table walk access

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Software preload access (with a translation table walk)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data TLB: Access (by SW preload)' that causes a refill or update of a data or unified TLB involving at least one translation table walk access

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Software preload access (with a translation table walk)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction TLB: Access (by SW preload)' that causes a refill or update of an instruction TLB involving at least one translation table walk access

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read/write)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a demand read or demand write access

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Access' that is due to a demand Instruction memory access. This includes instruction prefetches made by the PE for Speculatively executed instructions.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a preload or prefetch instruction

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Access' that is due to a preload or prefetch instruction

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Miss
event.description: The counter counts each demand access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access (due to read/write)' that misses in the Level 1 data or unified cache, causing an access to outside of the Level 1 caches of this PE

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access (by HW prefetcher)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Access' that is due to a hardware prefetch. The hardware prefetch is generated by a hardware prefetcher at the Level 1 instruction or unified cache. The PE might prefetch instructions as part of instruction pipelining, and might do so for Speculatively executed instruction paths. PE instruction prefetching is not counted as hardware prefetching. Unlike PE instruction prefetching, a hardware prefetch only allocates instructions into the cache.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access (by SW preload)' that causes a refill of the Level 1 data or unified cache from outside of the Level 1 data or unified cache

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Refill (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Access (by SW preload)' that causes a refill of the Level 1 instruction or unified cache from outside of the Level 1 instruction or unified cache

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read/write)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a demand memory read operation or demand memory write operation

event.title: L2 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: Counts L2 cache accesses that are due to a demand instruction cache access

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a preload or prefetch instruction. This includes accesses to the Level 2 data or unified cache due to a refill of another cache caused by a preload or prefetch instruction.

event.title: L2 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access (by SW preload)
event.description: Counts level 2 instruction cache accesses generated by software preload or prefetch instructions

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Miss
event.description: The counter counts each demand access counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Access (due to read/write)' that misses in the Level 1 and Level 2 data or unified caches, causing an access to outside of the Level 1 and Level 2 caches of this PE

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Access (by SW preload)' that causes a refill of the Level 2 data or unified cache, or any Level 1 data, instruction, or unified cache of this PE, from outside of those caches

event.title: L2 Instruction Cache
event.name: Refill (by SW preload)
event.description: Counts level 2 instruction cache refills generated by software preload or prefetch instructions

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read/write)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L3 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a demand memory read operation or demand memory write operation

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L3 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a preload or prefetch instruction. This includes accesses to the Level 3 data or unified cache due to a refill of another cache caused by a preload or prefetch instruction.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Miss
event.description: The counter counts each demand access counted by 'L3 Data Cache: Access (due to read/write)' that misses in the Level 1 to Level 3 data or unified caches, causing an access to outside of the Level 1 to Level 3 caches of this PE

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L3 Data Cache: Access (by SW preload)' that causes a refill of the Level 3 data or unified cache, or any Level 1 or Level 2 data, instruction, or unified cache of this PE, from outside of those caches

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (by HW prefetcher)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a hardware prefetch. The hardware prefetch is generated by a hardware prefetcher at the Level 1 data or unified cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (by HW prefetcher)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a hardware prefetch. The hardware prefetch is generated by a hardware prefetcher at the Level 2 data or unified cache.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Memory Bound)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend' when no instructions are delivered from the memory system. This includes the cycles counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Level 1 instruction cache)', 'Stalls: Frontend (Last level PE cache or memory)' and 'Stalls: Frontend (TLB miss)'.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Level 1 instruction cache)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Memory Bound)' when there is a demand instruction miss in the L1 instruction cache. If the complex is configured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event does not count if 'Stalls: Frontend (Last level PE cache or memory)' counts. If the complex is not configured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event is not implemented.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Last level PE cache or memory)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Memory Bound)' when there is a demand instruction miss in the last level of cache within the PE clock domain or a non- cacheable instruction fetch in progress. If the complex is configured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event is based on L2 cache misses. If the complex is not configured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event is based on L1 instruction cache misses.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (TLB miss)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Memory Bound)' when there is a demand instruction miss in the instruction or unified TLB

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Processor bound)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend' when the frontend is stalled on a frontend processor resource, not including memory. This includes the cycles counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Flow control)' and 'Stalls: Frontend (Flush recovery)'.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Flow control)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Processor bound)' when the frontend is recovering from a ush

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Flush recovery)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Processor bound)' when the frontend is recovering from a ush

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Memory bound)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend' when the backend is waiting for a memory access to complete. This includes the cycles counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Level 1 data cache)', 'Stalls: Backend (Memory Stall Cycles)', 'Stalls: Backend (Interlock, Store)' and 'Stalls: Backend (TLB)'.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Level 1 data cache)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Memory bound)' when there is a demand data miss in the L1 data cache. If the complex is configured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event does not count if 'Stalls: Backend (Memory Stall Cycles)' counts. If the complex is not configured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event is not implemented.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (TLB)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Memory bound)' when there is a demand data miss in the L1 data TLB

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Store)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, store

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Processor Bound)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend' when the backend is stalled on a processor resource, not including memory

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Backend busy)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend' when operations are available from the frontend but the backend is not able to accept an operation because an execution unit is busy

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Rename Full)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Processor Bound)' when operation are available from the frontend but at least one is not ready to be sent to the backend because no rename register is available

event.title: Atomic memory
event.name: Speculative Compare and Swap (near, fail)
event.description: This event counts compare and swap instructions that executed locally to the PE and did not update the location accessed

event.title: Atomic memory
event.name: Speculative Compare and Swap (near, pass)
event.description: The counter counts each Compare and Swap operation counted by 'Atomic memory: Speculative Compare and Swap (near)' that updates the location accessed

event.title: Atomic memory
event.name: Speculative Compare and Swap (near)
event.description: The counter counts each Compare and Swap operation that executes locally to the PE

event.title: Atomic memory
event.name: Speculative Compare and Swap (far)
event.description: The counter counts each Compare and Swap operation that does not execute locally to the PE

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Speculative Compare and Swap
event.description: This event counts the total compare and swap instructions that were executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Atomic Load
event.description: This event counts the total atomic memory instructions that return a value that were speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Atomic Store
event.description: This event counts the total atomic memory instructions that do not return a value that were speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Atomic Load or Store
event.description: This event counts the total atomic memory instructions that were speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Indirect branch without link excluding procedure return, taken
event.description: Counts architecturally executed indirect branch without link instructions, excluding return instructions, that were taken

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch with link, taken
event.description: Counts architecturally executed branch with link instructions that were taken

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch without link, taken
event.description: Counts architecturally executed branch without link instructions that were taken

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Indirect branch with link, taken
event.description: Counts architecturally executed indirect branch with link instructions that were taken

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Indirect branch without link, taken
event.description: Counts architecturally executed indirect branch without link instructions that were taken

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Direct branch with link, taken
event.description: Counts architecturally executed direct branch with link instructions that were taken

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Direct branch without link, taken
event.description: Counts architecturally executed direct branch without link instructions that were taken

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Unconditional branch
event.description: Counts architecturally executed unconditional branch instructions

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Conditional branch
event.description: Counts architecturally executed conditional branch instructions

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Translation table walk (block)
event.description: Counts number of demand data translation table walks caused by a miss in the L2 TLB and yielding a block descriptor at level 1 or level 2 of the translation

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Translation table walk (block)
event.description: Counts number of instruction translation table walks caused by a miss in the L2 TLB and yielding a block descriptor at level 1 or level 2 of the translation

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Translation table walk (page)
event.description: Counts number of demand data translation table walks caused by a miss in the L2 TLB and yielding a block descriptor at level 1 or level 2 of the translation

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Translation table walk (page)
event.description: Counts number of instruction translation table walks caused by a miss in the L2 TLB and yielding a page descriptor at level 3 of the translation

event.title: Bus
event.name: Bus request, read
event.description: The counter counts each transaction counted by 'Bus: Bus request' that is a memory read operation

event.title: Bus
event.name: Bus request, write
event.description: Counts memory write transaction requests issued by the CPU to the external bus

event.title: Bus
event.name: Bus request
event.description: The counter counts each request generated by a memory read operation or memory write operation that accesses outside of the boundary of the PE and its closely-coupled caches. Where this boundary lies with respect to any implemented caches is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED. Where an implementation has multiple buses at this boundary, this event counts the sum of requests across all buses.

event.title: Snooping (Instruction)
event.name: Hit (read)
event.description: The counter counts each snoop generated in response to a demand Instruction memory access that hits in a cache outside of the cache hierarchy of this PE

event.title: Snooping (Data)
event.name: Hit (prefetcher)
event.description: This event counts each data hardware prefetch that is satisfied by a snoop request that hits in a cache outside of the cache hierarchy of this PE

event.title: Snooping (Data)
event.name: Hit
event.description: The counter counts each snoop that hits in a cache outside of the cache hierarchy of this PE

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (by HW prefetcher)
event.description: The counter counts each hardware prefetch counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access (by HW prefetcher)' that causes a refill of the Level 1 data or unified cache from outside of the Level 1 data or unified cache

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (by HW prefetcher)
event.description: The counter counts each hardware prefetch counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Access (by HW prefetcher)' that causes a refill of the Level 2 data or unified cache, or any Level 1 data, instruction, or unified cache of this PE, from outside of those caches

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Hit (due to read)
event.description: The counter counts each demand fetch counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Access (due to read)' that hits in the Level 1 instruction or unified cache

event.title: L2 Instruction Cache
event.name: Hit (due to read)
event.description: Counts level 2 cache hits that are due to a demand instruction cache access

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Hit (by SW preload, due to read, first)
event.description: The counter counts each demand fetch first hit counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Hit (due to read)' where the cache line was fetched in response to a preload or prefetch instruction. That is, the 'L1 Instruction Cache: Refill (by SW preload)' event was generated when the cache line was fetched into the cache. Only the first hit by a demand access is counted. After this event is generated for a cache line, the event is not generated again for the same cache line while it remains in the cache.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Hit (by HW prefetcher, due to read, first)
event.description: The counter counts each demand fetch first hit counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Hit (due to read)' where the cache line was fetched by a hardware prefetcher. That is, the L1I_CACHE_REFILL_HWPRF event was generated when the cache line was fetched into the cache. Only the first hit by a demand access is counted. After this event is generated for a cache line, the event is not generated again for the same cache line while it remains in the cache.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (by HW prefetcher, due to read/write, first)
event.description: Counts first level 1 data demand cache hit from any load or store operation where the cache line was fetched by a hardware prefetcher

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (by HW prefetcher, due to read/write, first)
event.description: Counts L2 cache hits due to demand memory operations, which are the first demand hit on a cache line prefetched by a hardware prefetcher into the L2 cache

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Hit
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Access' that hits in the Level 1 instruction or unified cache

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Hit
event.description: Counts each access counted by 'L3 Data Cache: Access' that hits in the Level 3 cache. Level 3 cache is a unified cache for data and instruction accesses. Accesses are for misses in the lower level caches or translation resolutions due to accesses.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Hit
event.description: Counts each access counted by 'Last Level Cache: Access' that hits in the Last level cache. This event counts transactions for external last level cache when the system register CPUECTLR. EXTLLC bit is set, otherwise it counts transactions for L3 cache.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Hit (by SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each software preload counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Access (by SW preload)' that hits in the Level 1 instruction or unified cache

event.title: L2 Instruction Cache
event.name: Hit (by SW preload)
event.description: Counts level 2 instruction cache hits generated by software preload or prefetch instructions

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Hit (due to read, line-fill buffer)
event.description: The counter counts each demand access counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Hit (due to read)' that hits a recently fetched line in the Level 1 instruction or unified cache. That is, the access hits a cache line that is in the process of being loaded into the Level 1 instruction or unified cache, and so does not generate a new refill, but has to wait for the previous refill to complete.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (due to read, line-fill buffer)
event.description: Counts load data accesses that access the level 1 data cache and hit in a line that is in the process of being loaded into the level 1 data cache

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (due to write, line-fill buffer)
event.description: Counts store data accesses that access the level 1 data cache and hit in a line that is in the process of being loaded into the level 1 data cache

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (due to read/write, line-fill buffer)
event.description: Counts load or store data accesses that access the level 1 data cache and hit in a line that is in the process of being loaded into the level 1 data cache

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (due to read/write, line-fill buffer)
event.description: Counts load or store data accesses that access the level 2 data cache and hit in a line that is in the process of being loaded into the level 2 data cache

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Hit (by SW preload, due to read, first, line-fill buffer)
event.description: The counter counts each demand fetch line-fill buffer first hit counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Hit (due to read, line-fill buffer)' where the cache line was fetched in response to a preload or prefetch instruction. That is, the fetch hits a cache line that is in the process of being loaded into the Level 1 instruction or unified cache, and so does not generate a new refill, but has to wait for the previous refill to complete, and the 'L1 Instruction Cache: Refill (by SW preload)' event was generated when the cache line was fetched into the cache. Only the first hit by a demand access is counted. After this event is generated for a cache line, the event is not generated again for the same cache line while it remains in the cache.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Hit (by HW prefetcher, due to read, first, line-fill buffer)
event.description: The counter counts each demand fetch line-fill buffer first hit counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Hit (due to read, line-fill buffer)' where the cache line was fetched by a hardware prefetcher. That is, the fetch hits a cache line that is in the process of being loaded into the Level 1 instruction or unified cache, and so does not generate a new refill, but has to wait for the previous refill to complete, and the L1I_CACHE_REFILL_HWPRF event was generated when the cache line was fetched into the cache. Only the first hit by a demand access is counted. After this event is generated for a cache line, the event is not generated again for the same cache line while it remains in the cache.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (by HW prefetcher, due to read/write, first, line-fill buffer)
event.description: Counts first load or store data accesses that access the level 1 data cache and hit in a line that is in the process of being loaded into the level 1 data cache

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Hit (by HW prefetcher, due to read/write, first, line-fill buffer)
event.description: The counter counts each demand access line-fill buffer first hit counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Hit (due to read/write, line-fill buffer)' where the cache line was fetched by a hardware prefetcher

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (by HW prefetcher, or SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each fetch counted by either 'L1 Data Cache: Access (by HW prefetcher)' or 'L1 Data Cache: Access (by SW preload)'

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (by HW prefetcher, or SW preload)
event.description: The counter counts each fetch counted by either 'L2 Data Cache: Access (by HW prefetcher)' or 'L2 Data Cache: Access (by SW preload)'

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Floating Point)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed floating-point operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Advanced SIMD, SVE, SME' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Advanced SIMD, SVE, SME' that is an SME data-processing operation. Operations due to the following instructions are counted as SME data-processing operations: - Data-processing operations involving the ZA and ZT registers. This includes all operations that operate on the ZA or ZT registers, except those that are counted as load and store operations. Operations due to instructions added by FEAT_SME which involve the SVE registers but do not involve any ZA or ZT registers are counted as SVE data-processing operations.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Advanced SIMD, SVE, SME
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): All' that is an Advanced SIMD, scalable vector extension, or scalable matrix extension data-processing operation. See 'Instructions (Speculated): SVE and Avanced SIMD (all)' and 'Instructions (Speculated): SME' for these classifications.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Advanced SIMD, SVE, SME' that is classified as an SME operation. Operations due to the following instructions are counted as SME operations: - Data-processing operations involving the ZA and ZT registers. - Load and store operations involving the ZA and ZT registers. Operations due to instructions added by FEAT_SME which involve the SVE registers but do not involve any ZA or ZT registers are counted as SVE data-processing operations.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Advanced SIMD, SVE, SME
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): All' that is classified as an Advanced SIMD, scalable vector extension, or scalable matrix extension operation. See 'Instructions (Speculated): SVE and Avanced SIMD (all)' and 'Instructions (Speculated): SME' for these classifications.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Integer, 8-bit)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed 8-bit integer operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Integer)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array. Note: this includes operations attributed to LUTI2 8-bit integer instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Floating Point, BFloat16)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed BFloat16 floating-point operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Integer, 16-bit)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed 16-bit integer operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Integer)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array. Note: this includes operations attributed to LUTI2 and LUTI4 16-bit integer instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Floating Point, Half precision)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed half-precision floating-point operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Floating Point, Single precision)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed single-precision floating-point operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Floating Point, Add/Subtract)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed floating-point addition or subtraction instruction counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Floating Point, FMA)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed floating-point outer product and accumulate, or outer product and subtract instruction counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Floating Point, Dot Product)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed floating-point dot product instruction counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Floating Point, Matrix Outer Product Accumulate)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed floating-point outer product and accumulate, or outer product and subtract instruction counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Floating Point)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Integer)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed integer operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array. Note: this includes operations attributed to LUTI2 and LUTI4 integer instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Integer, Multiply)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed integer multiply, multiply-add, or multiply-subtract instruction counted by SE_INT_MUL_SPEC due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Integer, Dot Product)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed integer dot product instruction counted by SE_INT_DOT_SPEC due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Integer, Matrix Outer Product Accumulate)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed integer outer product and accumulate, or outer product and subtract instruction counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Integer)' due to an operation which reads from or writes to any part of the ZA array

event.title: Cycles
event.name: PSTATE.ZA Active Cycles
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Cycles: CPU Cycles' when PSTATE. ZA was enabled.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (No / Partially Active Predicates, 2D)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed predicated 2D SME operation which targets the ZA array counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Predicated, 2D)' where at least one element is Inactive. That is, at least one element in the Governing predicates is FALSE. For outer product instructions which are widening, predication is considered with respect to the input element size.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Predicated, 2D)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed 2D operation which targets the ZA array counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SVE (Predicated)' due to an SME instruction with a Governing predicate operand that determines the Active elements

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (No Active Predicates, 2D)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed predicated 2D SME operation which targets the ZA array counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (No / Partially Active Predicates, 2D)' where all elements are Inactive. That is, all elements in the Governing predicates are FALSE. For outer product instructions which are widening, predication is considered with respect to the input element size.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (All Active Predicates, 2D)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed predicated 2D SME operation which targets the ZA array counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Predicated, 2D)' where all elements are Active. That is, all elements in the Governing predicates are TRUE. For outer product instructions which are widening, predication is considered with respect to the input element size.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Partially Active Predicates, 2D)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed predicated 2D SME operation which targets the ZA array counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (No / Partially Active Predicates, 2D)' where neither all elements are Active nor all elements are Inactive. That is, the elements in the Governing predicates are neither all TRUE nor all FALSE. For outer product instructions which are widening, predication is considered with respect to the input element size.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Load/Store, ZA Unpredicated)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that reads from or writes to memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, Non-predicate Register)' that was due to an unpredicated instruction targeting the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Load, ZA Unpredicated)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that reads from memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, ZA Unpredicated)' that was due to an unpredicated instruction targeting the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Store, ZA Unpredicated)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that writes to memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, ZA Unpredicated)' that was due to an unpredicated instruction targeting the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Load/Store, ZT Unpredicated)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that reads from or writes to memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, Non-predicate Register)' that was due to an unpredicated instruction targeting the ZT register

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Load, ZT Unpredicated)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that reads from memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, ZT Unpredicated)' that was due to an unpredicated instruction targeting the ZT register

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Store, ZT Unpredicated)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that writes to memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, ZT Unpredicated)' that was due to an unpredicated instruction targeting the ZT register

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Load/Store, Non-predicate Register)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that reads from or writes to memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME' that was due to an unpredicated instruction targeting the ZA array or ZT register

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Load, Non-predicate Register)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that reads from memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, Non-predicate Register)' that was due to an unpredicated instruction targeting the ZA array or ZT register

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Store, Non-predicate Register)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that writes to memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, Non-predicate Register)' that was due to an unpredicated instruction targeting the ZA array or ZT register

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Load/Store, Tile)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that reads from or writes to memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, Non-predicate Register)' that was due to an instruction with at least one governing predicate which is targeting the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Load, Tile)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that reads from memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, Tile)' that was due to an instruction with at least one governing predicate which is targeting the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (Store, Tile)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed operation that writes to memory counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME (Load/Store, Tile)' that was due to an instruction with at least one governing predicate which is targeting the ZA array

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SME (LUT)
event.description: The counter counts each speculatively executed LUT operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): SME' that returns a value from a lookup table made up of a ZT register which is indexed by values from a Z register

event.name: Late prefetch
event.description: Late prefetch event
